full_summary:
# Request for Tender

## Invitation to Qualify - Stage 1

The Parks Canada Agency (PCA) invites qualified Contractors to submit a bid for the supply and installation of all labour, services, materials, testing, and equipment necessary to complete the Contract for the stage 1 - Cape Breton Highlands National Park - Ingonish Beach Washroom Facilities Replacement (Casernes).

## Project Description

The project involves the construction of a new washroom and kiosk facility and miscellaneous site work at the Cape Breton Highlands National Park, near Ingonish, Nova Scotia.

## Important Dates

- **Publication Date**: April 19, 2023
- **Tender Closing Date**: April 28, 2023 at 13:00:00
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: None
- **Expected Contract End Date**: None

## Trade Agreements and Regions

*   The bid is governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
*   The region of opportunity is limited to Nova Scotia.
*   The region of delivery is Canada.

## Contact Information

- **Contracting Authority**: Sheldon Lalonde
- **Email Address**: [sheldon.lalonde@pc.gc.ca](mailto:sheldon.lalonde@pc.gc.ca)
- **Phone Number**: 343-585-3836
- **Fax Number**: 1-855-983-1808

## Submission Requirements

- **Submission Method**: Bids will be accepted via email only.
- **Email Address**: [soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca)
- **File Size Limit**: 15 MB
- **Attachments**: Only PDF documents are accepted.

## Evaluation Criteria

Please note that the evaluation of bids will be based on the criteria outlined in the contract documents.

Please follow the instructions for submission requirements stated above.

**Note**: This is the first stage (Stage One) of a two-stage solicitation process. Followed by the evaluation of the submissions of Stage One, bidders will be advised of their qualification result and the status of the tender.

Successful bidders will have until March 31, 2024, to complete the work.

National Parks Regulations require that all work is performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

Bidders that consider themselves qualified to provide the work and intend to submit bids on this project should obtain documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service through
